game_description: Mortal Kombat is back and better than ever in the next evolution of the iconic franchise.
review:
I only paid $20 for this,  and the story mode was pretty good, so the way I see it I paid $20 for a decent story based fighter, but I agree with everyone who says the Krypt is grindy garbage, I don't like the fact that gear has levels and stuff, this isn't an an RPG, it's a fighting game, we don't need that B.S.

Also to go back to the Krypt it just seems like a glorified version of unboxing loot boxes since it's all randomized, you're basically exploring the Shang Tsun's palace while unlocking lootboxes, it was stupid in Armageddon and it's still stupid here. All in All, i'm glad I got the game for the price I did, and the story mode was neat, but i'm over it, I wish I had just youtubed it honestly or gave the game a rent.
review_bomb_reason: Das Spiel erhielt zu Release sehr viele negative Bewertungen, unter anderem aufgrund der von den Entwicklern "Netherrealm Studios" angeblich eingebauten "Social Justice Warrior / SJW - Propaganda" und politischen Agenda (weil in einem der Enden des Spiels ein dunkelhäutiger Charakter in die Vergangenheit reist, um die Sklaverei abzuschaffen), vielen Mikrotransaktionen und dem Fehlen von beliebten Charakteren aus früheren Teilen der Serie.

game_description: Mortal Kombat is back and better than ever in the next evolution of the iconic franchise.
review:
+ Looks and sounds good
+ Quick loading times
+ Great training mode and tutorials
+ Fast matchmaking and good netcode for the most part
+ Varied defensive wakeup options
+ Intuitive fighting game mechanics. Good for beginners
+ Cool fatalities and fatal blows

- Super simple. Takes 15 minutes to figure out a character completely. Many characters feel too similar
- Story mode sucks
- Half of the moves are locked out of ranked modes. Some character variations only have 2 moves
- Moves are on cooldown so you always meterburn specials if you have the meter
- Every character only has 2 to 3 different combos
- Some animations take too long and get repetitive

game_description: Mortal Kombat is back and better than ever in the next evolution of the iconic franchise. The all new Custom Character Variations give you unprecedented control to customize the fighters and make them your own. The new graphics engine showcasing every skull-shattering, eye-popping moment, brings you so close to the fight you can feel it. And featuring a roster of new and returning Klassic Fighters, Mortal Kombat's best in class cinematic story mode continues the epic saga over 25 years in the making.

game_description: Mortal Kombat is back and better than ever in the next evolution of the iconic franchise.
review:
Badly optimized, my laptop meets the required specs but I still get freezes. Most of the characters have the same range attacks with the same frame counts as well as the same teleportation ability (which makes them less unique). 
You are probably aware about the amount of grind this game has... Yes, it's even worse then you imagine. (A guy on reddit made the calculations and it is certain that you will have to pay 6000+ $ to unlock all the skins).

I kept comparing this game to Tekken 7, and I have to say, I am not downgrading my standards for this franchise (even though it's very popular).

By the way, this series is known for it's AMAZING fatalities, well, unfortunately they have blocked HALF of them by a pay wall...

review:
If you want to play the game for the cosmetics and gear, forget it (the story and online are great). At this moment the towers of time are the most annoying thing I encountered in a fighting game, the modifiers of some bosses are utterly ****, and they spam it every 2 f*cking seconds, and did I mention they were unblockeable? Yeah... really f*cking fun.

And the Krypt... where do I start? The whole thing is just a 30fps locked-horrible controlled-giant lootbox filled with random loot. Do you want that brutality or that piece of gear that says "unlocked on the Krypt"? well too f*ckng bad, you won't get it any time soon because 90% of things on the Krypt are icons, backgrounds, consumables or ugly skins nobody wants at the start.

The game could've easily been a 9 or a 10 if It wasn't for the stupid pay walls WB forced on the game.

game_description: Mortal Kombat is back and better than ever in the next evolution of the iconic franchise.
review:
I was a huge fan of Mortal kombat X, 
when I play fighting games i like to learn characters with fancy looking combo's, this also means i spend a lot of time in practice mode trying to learn all these long combo's and than try to mix them up unpredictably when i play against people.
That's where this game is different to it's predecessor instead of having long combo's that deal a lot of damage it's now way more neutral based, which means you get a hit in, do a short 20% combo and than try that again, so there's not really much combo's to learn at all. 
I also played injustice 2 in between both mk titles and liked it even more, because mkx was based around a lot of 50/50's which can get annoying, but in injustice there's a lot of footsies going on, but than if you can get a hit in you could follow this up with a nice combo unlike here.

Not nessecarely a bad game, just not my cup of tea.

game_description: Mortal Kombat is back and better than ever in the next evolution of the iconic franchise.
review:
Games should only focus on entertain the users, that's it, I don't want to see any reference to identity politics or anti-racist/anti-sexism propaganda. NRS is trying too hard to please the press mobs with political messages. 

- Regarding the controversy with female customs: If you are now against sexism why is Shao Kahn barely naked? I don't care if female characters are naked or dressed, but don't get "woke" just because you are afraid of the SJW press.

- Jax's ending making reference to the racism: Was that message really necessary?

- Shao Kahn (The bad guy) with the MAGA reference: FYI I would say 80% (at least) us MK players don't hate Trump, actually I'm sure many of them support him, congratulations for offending almost the entire MK player base.

I really want this SJW madness to be over, I cannot support a company that submits to this mob sorry.

Putting the SJW moments apart I will point out a few other things I don't like.

- The game looks like it's going to be micro-transaction festival

- Cut scenes and fatalities at 30FPS, this is supposed to be a PC version, I don't want to see laggy graphics, 30 FPS is not cinematic, it's just lag!

review:
I don't have time nor the money to experience the full mortal kombat experience even after I purchased  the damn game. The only thing I liked about it was the story mode, but as soon as that is over... the whole game starts barking at me for more time and money that I am incapable of producing. And don't get me started at the politics that is so pronounced in the game, I live in India, I don't want for some western developers spread their politics all over my face and ask me to digest it. What happened to the OG mortal kombat... shouldn't have bought it.
Ah yes... As a man, I feel disgusted at how can there be so many naked men in the game?...  We men are not some toy, our body is sacred.

review:
I've always been a huge Mortal Kombat fan. The original Mortal Kombat was the first video game I ever played. I've always enjoyed the games, and this one will be no different. 

But day one DLC should just be part of the game. I mean, you could even pre-order it with the game. If you want to sell characters that's fine, but make the game free and just do micro transactions. I have a feeling they are just gonna do micro transactions anyway.

And featuring a roster of new and returning Klassic Fighters, Mortal Kombat's best in class cinematic story mode continues the epic saga over 25 years in the making.
review:
The game is maximum 2/10 at best

I feel ripped off by Netherrealm. I had to pre-order the game to get Shao Khan as he's a pre-order bonus, and after doing so you are greeted with an in-game store and microtransaction menus. It does not feel like a full-price game. It feels like a mobile free to play game in which you need to buy the game content with real money. Otherwise, you can trap yourself in an endless grind to get items, and by the way everything is randomized.

Random chance of getting your items upon random chance of getting your modifier. And to win anything you need consumables that need grinding as well.

The fact that developers tricked you in to thinking that the game does not have loot boxes before launch, and then get you to grind and use convoluted and manipulative tactics to get even more money from you as opposed to let you enjoy the game and unlock items the usual way (by playing the game) is very concerning and outright evil.

It is very disappointing and honestly makes me regret getting the game and wishing that I had not purchased it. I highly recommend that you avoid making the same mistake that I have, and I would urge you to wait on the game or even skip it altogether.

game_description: Mortal Kombat is back and better than ever in the next evolution of the iconic franchise.
review:
I don't hate this game. I think if you are playing against friends it's a great game. But the grinding you have to do and the towers of time challenges can be a bit much. The grind feels worse then Injustice 2. The kript is amazing I enjoy it. But the currency in this game is so hard to get I almost feel like I'm spending actual money. I want to not like this game just because of those reasons. They should have kept the game play more like Mortal Kombat X. It does feel a bit to much like Injustice 2. 
I really like MK and i got a lot of enjoyment out of X. This game just doesn't meet the same level of gameplay. 

I still don't hate this game it's just a bit of a grind for stuff and I personally don't have anyone to play with lol. I'd enjoy it more with friends. I don't know what thumbs to give it. Personally I wish I waited to buy it. $100 dollars was a bit much. My thumbs down is from the fact I've had this game for only a few days and I'm already playing another game as I write this. I was playing MK 11 and I just felt like I don't want to do this right now. And possibly tomorrow ether. 
I grinded for 114 hours for a final fantasy game. And that felt worth it. I grinded for a few days on this game and I just got fed up. Sorry NRA I'm just not feeling it.

The new graphics engine showcasing every skull-shattering, eye-popping moment, brings you so close to the fight you can feel it. And featuring a roster of new and returning Klassic Fighters, Mortal Kombat's best in class cinematic story mode continues the epic saga over 25 years in the making.
review:
What a disappointing entry in the MK franchise!

A lot of fan favourites are missing (Mileena, Rain, Sindel, Smoke...). The story is abysmal, makes no sense at all
review_bomb_reason: Das Spiel erhielt zu Release sehr viele negative Bewertungen, unter anderem aufgrund der von den Entwicklern "Netherrealm Studios" angeblich eingebauten "Social Justice Warrior / SJW - Propaganda" und politischen Agenda (weil in einem der Enden des Spiels ein dunkelhäutiger Charakter in die Vergangenheit reist, um die Sklaverei abzuschaffen), vielen Mikrotransaktionen und dem Fehlen von beliebten Charakteren aus früheren Teilen der Serie.

review:
This game is digusting and I'm not talking about the game's blood and gore. It's a complete grindy mess, so grindy with RNGness that it forces you to partake in micro transactions.. Mortal Kombat is one of my favorite video game franchises and to see it turn into this complete mess is just sad. I paid 100 bucks for the premium edition and then they have the audacity to ask for 5 bucks per skin (even simple recolors).

I never thought Ed Boon and Netherrealm would ever go down this disgusting microtransaction path.. What a shame.

game_description: Mortal Kombat is back and better than ever in the next evolution of the iconic franchise.
review: Playing with people, gameplay is perfectly fine. The fact the Towers of Time is so bullshit with so many factors against the player for the sake of "adding difficulty", instead of making a competent CPU, is completely unfair. There is no satisfaction, it feels like a gacha game. The grind isn't just tedious, it's "difficult". The towers being timed puts pressure on players to just keep throwing themselves at the tower, just feeling more frustrated. DO NOT play this game if you plan on wanting anything beyond what you immediately get when you first open the game. NRS just want you to buy their shitty consumable skips for free money.

game_description: Mortal Kombat is back and better than ever in the next evolution of the iconic franchise. The new graphics engine showcasing every skull-shattering, eye-popping moment, brings you so close to the fight you can feel it. And featuring a roster of new and returning Klassic Fighters, Mortal Kombat's best in class cinematic story mode continues the epic saga over 25 years in the making.
review:
Mortal Kombat was one of the first games I owned on the SNES and is my favorite fighting game franchise of all-time. So it pains me endlessly to observe what a fall from grace this entry in the long-running franchise is. I saw the writing on the wall as soon as the female fighter's Kostumes were revealed. The hypocritical, benevolent sexism on display as character lead, Brendan George shamelessly shut down the desires of the fans to see the female fighters in more Klassic attire should have been enough to keep me from buying this game day 1. Whenever a company devalues the input and desires of a Konsumer and opts to thrust their own ideology, moral superiority and virtue onto those who have kept you in business for 27 years it should be an automatic "wait and see, let's not buy this right away".

This isn't even the biggest concern though, the disgusting level of grind and microtransactions just to unlock much-coveted items in the krypt is ludicrous for anyone paying $80.00 upfront for this game. The "woke-anda" ending for Jax, and the Drumpf Khan "make Outworld great again" needlessly infusing of politics into a simple fighting game just adds insult to injury. It comes off as completely tone deaf, and just gives the impression that NRS is purposefully altering Ed Boon's vision to be more compliant with the woke-mafia, so as to appease the majority far left-leaning game's journos in return for praise and positive reviews. If you need evidence that Boon's vision was Kompromised then look up the interview where he states that Kronika (the main boss) was originally meant to be male. If Boon had no Kontrol over something as significant as the main boss, then it's likely that many more aspects of this game were perverted in order to cow-tow to the regressive left.

Here's a warning: game journos and activists do not keep you in business. Kontinue to disregard the wills and wants of your fan base and your nightmares will be haunted by the phrase: "Get Woke, Go Broke"

That is all.

review: The most significant problem with this game is that I had a feeling that i'm playing FIFA. Too litle changes have been made. Storymode is absurd, but very enjoyable. But beside that - is a best itteration of mobile grind and monetisation on a market. Selling character that I allready own, serriosly? What next? You will be given us first 10 hours for $60? Next every hour per $5? Beside that, customisation of charaxters is a missed opportunity. Bland, ugly and pale realisation. No bikini in a blood sport fight I can accept. But why males are naked then? Result is a silly, borring and ugly looking game with an insane monetisation system.

review:
Unfortanely I Came To Say Tht this game is not worth even the 80  euros i spent on it

Pros: 
-Good Game Story
-Tutorials tht explain the mechanics even tutorials for the individual characters
-Good and Balanced Combat
- Interesting concept of AI Team Battle (Online)
-Awesome Graphics

Now the worst Of This Game
-Horrible Concept Of the Krypt
-Plain MicroTrasanctions
-Plain Pure Luck Chests (lootboxes) Forget What They Say , the moment u open a chest and is based on luck it is a FUCKIN 
  Lootbox
-Pure And Unforgiving Concept Of Towers Of Time, it only rewards if u use Konsumables or are Pure lucky on the fight
    -The Ai was more advantage than U , the abilities or advantages are completely on a different level than the ones u can 
     have or obtain
    -It doesnt reward skill , so forget it doesnt matter how good, u are gonna get trashed by stupid factors
    -  The rewards or koins are not worth the time and effort
    - It literally tells u to spend money to skip fights or obtain advantages
    - It Literally doesnt bring challenge or fun on this mod, Stay on Klassic Towers mod
- No decent rewards system so u can keep on to complete towers
- The most sad aspect it tht even the fatalities are unlockable and depedent if u find on the chests
- The supposed bonus unlocked on items of costumization are just confusing and the items are random so good luck tryng to find wth u need 

To my conclusion this game is not worth buyng at full price, if u are interested forget it, wait like previous game for full complete edition or real big promotion, it is sad because the concepts they show are interesting but they ruined with microtransactions mentality,

Until this game removes or changes the grind party this game is , my review will be  negative
Now lets see if they gonna bring changes which i doubt ...

game_description: Mortal Kombat is back and better than ever in the next evolution of the iconic franchise.
review: So I have finished the story which I liked all the way up until the final boss fight. The final fight is so annoyingly hard that it isn't even fun. Tried some of the games other modes to see how fast you can earn coins for the krypt. Now my numbers are against ai and the tower, matches against real people might give you more. That being said I was averaging 120 coins per win without using consumables. The average chest amount in the krypt is around 6k-7k (like I said this is an average of chest costs) so that means you have to win 50-58 games against an ai opponent to open one chest and not all chests are unlock with koins some require hearts which requires 250 hearts to open. You earn hearts by doing fatalities and brutalities but sadly you get screwed here too by only earning 2 hearts per. So now you have to perform 125 fatalities to open one chest. I hope when they do the patch this all gets fixed but as of right now this is just predatory practices by NRS.

review:
I'm totally fed up with game developing companies which trying to **** all your money in all dirty ways.Also I started to hate SJW things. I have nothing against people with other gender or race but in my opinion SJW are posers.They don't really care about people's problems and do it only for money. And then greedy game developers and SJW uniting we got products like MK11, Battlefield 5, new STAR WARS games. It's new tendencies to make products to satisfy not loyal fans but the small group of people who don't even play videogames. It's betrayal of fans who supported the MK and Boon and NetherRealm at the very beginning. Now they turn away us and thinking only about business (MK 11 is not even original game but upgraded Injustice 2!). And I blame us, gamers, in creating this situation because we are continuing to buy their unfinished and cutted products. We must end this tendencies. I offer to make posts, videos, songs or whatever dedicated to problem. Call it
#iwontbuyyourgame  and spread it in internet. P.S Sorry for my bad English

game_description: Mortal Kombat is back and better than ever in the next evolution of the iconic franchise.
review:
-Much of the cosmetic content (includes fatalities) and gear is locked behind an unfair grindwall. It will take actual years to get every item. Currently there are 7 currencies. 
-Game drops to 30fps for cutscenes, fatal blows, and cinematics. Disrupts the flow of game.
-Tournament presets are not default and must be set in practice mode.
-Required to be online, in between every menu there is a connecting to server dialog box.
-Frost is unlockable by completing chapter 4 in game, but they offer an option to buy her outright.
-Unable to skip end match cutscenes i.e. fatalities. Time adds up considering there are in game requirements like 75 fatalities.

edit:
-Patch version not up to date with console version.
-Lead dev/creator responds to serious problems with emoticon riddled tweets.
-Their proposed fix is to offer currency and lower AI difficulty/health. This does NOT in anyway get rid of the grindwall, it only shortens it. Most of the rewards are all still random and you have to go through the gacha-like process of unlocking items.

+Netcode is some of the best. On top of connection and benchmark results, you can see if the opponent in on a wired or wireless connection.
+Tutorial and available information is extremely well done.
+ Gameplay is solid and almost all characters seem viable.

I'm not necessarily an MK fan, but I enjoy fighting games. The amount of negatives in this game far outweigh the positives. To me it screams corporate greed and laziness. The game definitely has some very good aspects, never seen in other high profile fighting game titles. But all those are brought down by the huge glaring issues.

Do not recommend, stay far away until they tone down the grindwall.

game_description: Mortal Kombat is back and better than ever in the next evolution of the iconic franchise. The all new Custom Character Variations give you unprecedented control to customize the fighters and make them your own. The new graphics engine showcasing every skull-shattering, eye-popping moment, brings you so close to the fight you can feel it. And featuring a roster of new and returning Klassic Fighters, Mortal Kombat's best in class cinematic story mode continues the epic saga over 25 years in the making.
review:
Let me first say I generelly like Mortal Kombat and was always a big fan. I liked MK 9, even 10 (to a lesser degree) but this... this really is unacceptable. I was dead set on buying this game when I first saw the trailer, but then I remembered Injustice 2. This game is everything that's wrong with gaming today.

1. Lootboxes
2. Trying to appease people that you're never gonna appease. Remodeling every single female fighter outfit, without even the option to give them their old outfit.
3. Always online
4. MicrotransactionHELL
5. Grindy af progression system,  so point 4 gets pushed.

I really wanna like this game, but fighting games as of late really are an insult to every costumer. Even one of these 5 pointes is non-starter for me, but all 5 in one game... you done f*cked up NRS and WB, which is a shame because the fighting looks really fun.

The all new Custom Character Variations give you unprecedented control to customize the fighters and make them your own. review:
Money Money Money .... never enough, after buy premium edition at 80 € you need to pay more and more because a wall of grind it's just a shame.
Stop those microtransaction stop the "loot box" in the krypt, enough is enough

game_description: Mortal Kombat is back and better than ever in the next evolution of the iconic franchise.
review: The gameplay is good but it is clear the company only cares about the console version. Still waiting on the "day one" patch while the consoles have already got a second patch. The story mode is good but the rest of the game is revolved around towers that are impossible. The devs have admitted this but patch is only out for consoles. Don't buy this version. If you want to play go buy it on Ps4 or just skip if that isn't option.

game_description: Mortal Kombat is back and better than ever in the next evolution of the iconic franchise. The all new Custom Character Variations give you unprecedented control to customize the fighters and make them your own. The new graphics engine showcasing every skull-shattering, eye-popping moment, brings you so close to the fight you can feel it. And featuring a roster of new and returning Klassic Fighters, Mortal Kombat's best in class cinematic story mode continues the epic saga over 25 years in the making.
review: This game had the potential to be good, but any quality is buried under predatory microtransactions, characters locked behind future DLC, and pay-to-win models, while if you try to play in the online lobbies get used to server disconnects and lag.  The developers have really let themselves down here.  Then again, they also blatantly lied to and mocked the fanbase, so possibly karma has come back to them.

game_description: Mortal Kombat is back and better than ever in the next evolution of the iconic franchise.
review:
The game is very buggy, AA makes the game look like the switch version, and whats with the super hard towers? Too hard? Not enough luck? Don't like grinding? well, you can use real money to unlock the skins you want!

I almost bought Frost DLC, luckily I decided to research before purchasing, Frost is free, you just have to play couple hours in story mode. Kinda sneaky from Netherrealm Studios IMO. 

This game will be cheap in couple weeks, just wait.

review: Includes Microtransaction, Lootboxes and a calculated grind to match. Then they have the nerve to also have a gender bias in the story mode and when it comes to how much skin is shown by the characters? honestly either cover everyone up or no one. Don't be fooled by the pretty graphics, this is yet another game made with greed, masquerading as Social Justice.

And featuring a roster of new and returning Klassic Fighters, Mortal Kombat's best in class cinematic story mode continues the epic saga over 25 years in the making.
review:
I say the same as the other guy:

I just wanted one thing: Ermac to be in the game.
He's not in, so the game isn't delivering imo.
Also,all the microtransactions **** and the always online and rng based krypt is ****...MK9 and XL were alot better.

review:
Riddled with microtransactions and a grind wall. Great visuals and voice acting, but all the rest is a major turnoff. Netherrealm and WB is just out to get your money. Keep it in your pocket.
Heavily feels like a mobile game.

Censorship is also a concern. Ridiculous double standards where men are half naked but women are clothed to the neck. Gone are the days of Klassic Mortal Kombat.

Get woke, go broke.

game_description: Mortal Kombat is back and better than ever in the next evolution of the iconic franchise.
review: This is my first Mortal Kombat game on pc. I've played this game for 10+ years, i run a ryzen 7 2700x and a rx580 gpu...There is NO REASON why i should have to play this game at 60 fps the game is litterally locked at 60fps even in story mode and im very very upset about it. Leaving that aside i do enjoy the game so far but honestly 60fps looks dogshyt!

game_description: Mortal Kombat is back and better than ever in the next evolution of the iconic franchise.
review:
NRS and WB trying to milk Peoples Bank Account with so many Microtransactions.
AA is broken and blurry , 30fps lock in cut scenes, krypt , fatality, main menu.

Game released later than on Consoles, Patches released later on PC as well.
PC Version just seems to be last priority to NRS.

After they noticed that people bash them for their sad attempt of in game purchases they promised fixes.

Some dedicated MK Player made Mod to remove 30FPS lock and make it 60 instead.
As soon you discuss it on forums NRS will delete your thread and silence you or eventually ban you cause they are ashamed of them self since other people need to fix their mess.

But we all know that Censorship is nothing new when it comes to NRS and their Burka Kombat Game. LOL!
Also NRS tried to shove Political Agenda and hidden messages into the Game , they dont belong in a MK Game.

The Game has a high Price for a Game that will soon get more and more DLC Content and probably more and more in game purchases like a 2nd class mobile Game or another EA Product.
So i cant even recommend this Game if it cost 10 Bucks, it should be free instead.

I refunded this Mess and bought Anno 1800 instead , they wont be fixing this Crap anytime soon and after all they have done with their "Good People Agenda" i dont plan on ever buying a Game by WB or NRS ever again.

Devs and publishers should understand again that they !!!need!! Customers who buy their Game and not the other way around. 
I DONT need this publisher and this studio, i also dont need a broken Game that i buy with my good Money.

review: I absolutely understand every single person who gave this game a bad rating. I wanted to like it, I really did. Mobile Kombat 11 is just a mobile game, but without the microtransactions, which makes it even worse, as you have no way around the pointless grinding. For example, the whole crypt loot is completely RNG. You still have coordinates and some sort of a map, which is useless, simply due to the fact that the items are randomized. I am not really sure if Nethrerealm studios are not the brightest staff upstairs, or they have a weird sense of **** crypt chests are just like loot boxes. In order to get the cool skins, fatalities, brutalities & etc you need to open chests in the crypt. In order to open the chests, you need to gather 3 different kinds of currencies (please note that neither of those currencies can be obtained with real money) from the Towers of Time. In order to complete the towers of time, you need consumables, which are found in the chests in crypt, which I already mentioned is completely RNG. There is no way around that. You either have to regularly check the in-game store to see if your desired skin is available, so you can spend real money for it, or go through the senseless grind explained above. Please, do not buy Mobile Kombat 11.

review: This games combat is okay same mortal kombat feel just slower however half the game is unplayable due to it being locked behind towers of time as well the random krypt for customizing your character and i mean character to have a few would take years to do. Towers of time feels like test your luck in other MK games except there is content locked behind it. Story mode is not great, voice acting is garbage, and grind is ridiculously long. The only reason this dosen't get a 0 is the decent experience ive had online and the story mode if they don't fix something quick this game WILL DIE and im sad to say that.

review:
Well, the gameplay is good, so long as you play competitively with other people. However, that's about where the positives stop. The predatory monetization tactics that started to show up in Injustice 2 have come in full force, with a multitude of premium currencies costing obscene amounts of real-world money and locking cosmetics, gear, finishers, intros, basically anything that isn't directly tied to the gameplay. On top of this, they've even made it difficult to unlock these items if you're willing to spend the money, since there isn't a way to purchase them directly beyond a store with 5 options that refreshes every 8 hours or so.

If you're a fighting game die-hard like myself, and can survive on gameplay alone, then the game is likely a worthwhile purchase. But if you aren't, stay far, far away until they fix this blatant disregard for the consumer.

game_description: Mortal Kombat is back and better than ever in the next evolution of the iconic franchise.
review:
What can I say I've been an MK fan for a long time. I skipped MKX due to the poorly ran launch. figured hey they're advertising MK11 hard, pulling all the stops, and have a on-time release of the game on PC.

First the 12am release wasn't based on time zones
Then the pre-load didn't even unpack the files. 
After 12 more hours of waiting you had to wait another 30min. based  on your drive speed
Cool whatever i'm fine I will still get to play.


Main menu was locked at 30fps, cutscenes 30fps, middle of the fight x-rays 30fps. Framedrops during fights. Audio de-sync during cutscenes making the kampagin unplayable. plus all the cool extreme RNG grind you have to do. Why are my graphics gutted on a PC? Sure it's a port, but shouldn't be a good one? 

Anyways i'm refunding until probably MK11X or something that fixes all the bugs that they gave up on. I'm sure they delayed the PC release to gather good buzz from console so PC doesn't get a voice. Such a shame I was looking forward to playing it. 

Those who defend this as,"Oh it's a new game it's going to have bugs" no a AAA publisher has the time a money to hire a company to do a port, if they port it, to have it be playable on the get go, and utilize hardware correctly.

game_description: Mortal Kombat is back and better than ever in the next evolution of the iconic franchise.
review: Coming from MKX, this is the most disappointed in a game i have been in a long time. The combat in this game is extremely barebones. you will have two combos for each character that you alternate between accordingly. 50/50s have been removed from most of the kast which you would think was a good thing until you can no longer open up opponents as everything is easily reactable/fuzzyable. Throws and punishing dashes will be your primary means of dealing damage. Recharging meter removes player agency and any tension previously found in the start of a match (the most important time window), Matches will desync constantly. Cannot play towers or king of the hill without the game crashing. controller will not work without tabbing out and then back into the game. Most of a characters combo options are locked to kasual modes leaving you lucky to break a 5 hit. Ambient occlusion and anti-aliasing are broken making the one character I play (Kano) an eyesore. There is no word on when or if this game will get fixed. And to top it all off NRS has removed the PC version from their list of supported platforms and distanced themselves from the port entirely. I wouldn't even call this "game" a cash grab. It feels more like a scam.

game_description: Mortal Kombat is back and better than ever in the next evolution of the iconic franchise.
review: It's ironic that the most story-driven game in fighting game history has lost the narrative it helped start in the first place. Mortal Kombat used to be about accessibility and pushing boundaries. Now it's about playing it safe by being offensively violent and gory - something that no one has actually cared about in years. Great, you can really see those vertebrae as that guy's spine is ripped into 27 lovingly animated pieces. Why is EVERY dude shirtless and the women are all conservatively dressed? Why does it take a master's course in pattern memorization and button inputs to even play the game? Why are there more F2P elements here than any single thing I've ever installed on my iPhone? WHO IS THIS GAME EVEN FOR ANYMORE?

review:
Alright, first of all I want to say is "GET WOKE GO BROKE" just for the sake of mocking Jax's quote at the end of the game.

Secondly, if it's not the stupid developer decisions regarding the story that'll make you avoid this game, then it'll be the microtransactions, the game is full of it.

It's an awful attempt at a cash-grab and it's made even more evident when you think about how much the game caters to political correctness just for the sake of getting extra "morally superior cause" points and get more people to buy the game which was ultimately this game's downfall.

Do NOT buy the game, even as a joke, it's truly THAT bad.

PS: Leftists hate microtransactions more than rightist, so if you go full woke just to get more money from microtransactions, then don't.

review:
This entry in the Mortal Kombat series has beautiful graphics and I enjoy the way you can spend meter defensively and offensively separately. Unfortunately, that’s all the positive remarks I can give this game.  The use of micro-transactions, which has been calculated to cost 6000$ if you don’t grind and the use of pandering for a demographic that mostly doesn’t care about this series left me bothered. We have the character designer saying that “ you wouldn’t want to fight half naked” as justification for the female characters being in full body armour, despite the fact most of the men are wearing only loincloths; which even goes against the canon of the character of Scarlet, who needs her enemy’s blood to make contact with her to gain power.

I believe that a game that inherently doesn’t have anything to do with politics shouldn’t force to, because as we’ve seen, it has brought the ratings down.

On a separate note, I’d like to say, that I’m fine with reusing resources, but the fact that Kabal’s fatality is a direct ripoff of the Flash’s super in Injustice 2 felt extremely lazy on NetherRealms’ part.

The game also felt oddly rushed, we got a new character reveal every day, which isn’t that great for hyping up the fan base, and the story was left with inconsistencies that felt really weird. I get no one plays these games for the story, and it is a massive improvement from previous entries, but it felt incomplete.

TL;DR: The game forces politics where it shouldn’t, uses micro transactions that can cost up to 6000$ feel like a profoundly inept move from the team at NeatherRealms Studio. Still love Ed Boon but this felt odd.

review:
Another franchise I previously loved, made completely devoid of any appeal due to awful micro-transactions (there are at least 4 different in-game currencies that I was able to discover, maybe even more) political correctness (all the best character costumes from the franchise have been removed to appease SJWs), and awful "grindy" pacing in order to monetise the crap out of players following launch. It's the worst of everything currently infecting the industry and whilever devs take this approach they will never get a penny out of me. Refunded back to Amazon.

The devs should remember the following.

1: Customer satisfaction and loyalty is always worth more than predatory monetisation policies
2: SJW's don't buy your games anyway, stop capitulating to their trolling demands for censorship and moral virtue signalling (the Jax end-story is complete eye-rolling crap).

Do not buy this game as you are supporting these practices.

game_description: Mortal Kombat is back and better than ever in the next evolution of the iconic franchise.
review:
6/10

So I've tried to have a fair shot at this game and I can't give it a positive review, I genuinely believe this game was released to early and wasn't fully tested.

I'm usually a hardcore online player and on release we have the most unbalanced cast I've ever seen in a fighting game, lets just face it Jax and Geros own the whole cast. So many moves are safe on characters for no particular reason and some characters have easy 5-7 crushing blows where some have less than 5.

The stupid mobile mechanics means I can't unlock skins without playing the trash boring Tower of Time, where you don't get to actually play the real game and get beat by rng mechanics. 

The only saving grace is Story Mode but the game isn't worth £50 for that just buy it in 2 years time in a sale or watch it on youtube.

game_description: Mortal Kombat is back and better than ever in the next evolution of the iconic franchise. The all new Custom Character Variations give you unprecedented control to customize the fighters and make them your own. The new graphics engine showcasing every skull-shattering, eye-popping moment, brings you so close to the fight you can feel it. And featuring a roster of new and returning Klassic Fighters, Mortal Kombat's best in class cinematic story mode continues the epic saga over 25 years in the making.
review:
The gaming industry is a massive money-making machine that is oversaturated and extremely competitive. The consumer is oftentimes pushed around by the whims of current cultural trends, profit model trends, and key decision makers that have either lost sight of what gamers want or don’t care and are laughing all the way to the bank.

Mortal Kombat 11 suffers from an identity crisis. The push to maximizes profits and make shareholders happy coupled with a company trying to reinvent its aging and outdated brand in the current cultural climate has diminished that same brand. A brand that was once at the forefront of the “games aren’t just for kids” movement. Was never about social conformity. It’s not about counting quarters anymore, but much bigger money. The pressure to keep profit margins and brand awareness (and acceptance) high has ironically led yet another game down the wrong priority path.

Come on, this is a game that spells Combat with a K and has fighters ripping other fighters in half. They purposefully chose to go with a grind that pushes toward microtransactions! It doesn’t matter that they patched it. They had intended to squeeze as much out of the consumer as possible (and the biggest reason this is getting a 0). No skimpy outfits? I get both sides of the argument. Objectification Vs Censorship. Again, this is a brand known for its brutality but they seem to have said this isn’t a hill worth dying on? They did some picking and choosing on what they wanted to be socially responsible with. Like Battlefront 2, Mortal Kombat 11 is not a bad game, but the business has gotten in the way of the entertainment.

game_description: Mortal Kombat is back and better than ever in the next evolution of the iconic franchise.
review:
If you were to make every chest in the Krypt absolutely free, you would still blow a stupid amount of time unlocking them because a lot of them have tower of time consumable items. The Krypt item locations are completely random, and  resemble a lootbox system, with the only difference being that instead of buying the lootboxes, you can buy the stuff you ACTUALLY WANT FROM THEM in their time crystal shop. So disregarding the Krypt content completely, you're left with very small amount of content. I'm sure NRS made this decision intentionally despite whatever they have said to the contrary because for the first time, the Krypt content is absolutely randomized per person, so you can't just look up their locations. To NRS: Nobody has ever found it to be fun or rewarding to blindly pick chests in previous MK games. Everyone has access to the internet looks up where the stuff they want is.
Story mode is decent enough, actually wish it had almost no fights because it makes for a decent movie almost. The actual fighting feels like a step down from 10 honestly, but isn't completely bad. Mortal Blows (X rays) had their condition changed to Tekken 7 Rage Arts (under a certain percentage of health will let you do them) and it feels less like something you build up in the match and more like a cheap comeback mechanic. 
Visually the game looks great. MBs are stuck at 30 fps for some reason though. 
For $60 though the game is severely lacking. I feel ripped off for the ~$40 I payed. If you're itching for a fighter, wait for a decent sale on Tekken 7 with all the DLC, or DBZ Fighterz, or if you have played all that, go find out how to play Line Kill Spirits. It's stupid and an embarrassment to play, but it's less embarrassing than blowing $60 on a game you get bored of the day after (yes that was me, and I played the cr@p out of 9 and 10) and I am actually getting more enjoyment out of playing LKS with a buddy than MK11. Give the game another shot if and only if the price goes down and they make everything in the Krypt predetermined.

review: Microtransactions? You have got to be kidding me.....thought you guys would have learned by now.  Being a longtime fan, playing the original MK when I was eight years old in a arcade, I never thought the day would come when I would have to shout : KEEP POLITICS OUT OF VIDEO GAMES! This is supposed to be an escape from the pressures of normal life and Jax should be the most patriotic character in the game! You have lost your way.

game_description: Mortal Kombat is back and better than ever in the next evolution of the iconic franchise.
review:
I have all ghrapics settings on max and on stable 60fps (gtx 1060 6gb) and I am not impressed.

Gamplay feels rather slow, restricted movement ruins it, like no running.

I expected Warner Bros to learn from their mistake.

Going back to Tekken 7 with my unlimited freedom of movement, making it possible for players to reach their utmost potential.

review:
I signed up for this website just to write this review.
First, the game play itself is actually fun.  BUT it is so grindy, and not all the move s are available 24/7, you have to get gear to get slots to put moves in to have a good character. I don't care about the endings, (no matter how half assed they are with their painting endings) and the stupid damn Krypt to roam around in is dumb. review:
If you don't like spending money on bad games, stay away. This is a bad video game.


The game on launch was a mess.


30 FPS cap. The Krypt runs even worse than that.
The game is more clunky than ever before, leaving only 1/3 of the roster feeling like actual fighting game characters that can chain multiple moves together.

TERRIBLE fightstick support.

The cutscenes in story desync and have the audio and video not match up properly after just a few minutes of play time.

This game is truly a disaster.

review:
Pros
Great story, beautiful graphics

Cons
- VERY grindy (talking P2W grindy)

- Customization. almost all the "different" skins are the same thing with a different color scheme. Sure, objectification is a thing these days, but no one has to choose the revealing suit on the females, just like they don't have to have the men shirtless. Make it a choice. At least bring back the classic outfits. Make the different skins actually different. Color changes should not be an unlockable for a full price game and a game is not a place to force your political SJW beliefs on people.

- amount of playable characters. In a game where the past meets the present, The opportunity to bring in ALL the bad ass characters in the MK universe was unprecedented. Instead most were left out. (and several of the fan favorites.) Unless they're going to show up as DLC. which is cool for the major players (Goro) but not so much for the regulars (Mileena, **** many to list)

- tower difficulty is stupid. Just stupid. Medium difficulty (the lowest I've seen so far) actually translates to absurd. Every battle has an opponent only modifier ranging from extra damage to a second opponent showing up to juggle you to infinity. Noob Saibot has a modifier where you go "blind" when **** playing MK with your TV turned off.......yeah, that stupid.

Basically is a beautiful game with a great storyline that seemed more concerned with a cash grab than giving players what they want. Everything they did right with Injustice 2 (costume customization, varying difficulty towers, char progression, etc.) they've abandoned here. I'm betting the MK fanbase is gonna shrink substantially after this one. The inevitable MK12 will be a "wait till it's on sale" buy for **** I bother at all.
Should have bought the PC version on Steam so I could have refunded it.

So I just played again after the update. Tripled the currency rewards, which allows you to grind chests faster, but still grindy. Tower difficulty has been very slightly adjusted, but most are still way too hard for average players like myself.  Even after the update, I'd still refund it if I could.

game_description: Mortal Kombat is back and better than ever in the next evolution of the iconic franchise.
review:
This is the first game I've ever refunded on steam, and one of the few I've ever preordered. I am a big MK fan, I've played most of them over the years, and after MK X was finally fixed it was a decent if not good game. This on the other hand, fails to impress. For $100 USD I am expecting a polished game on release. That is not what I got. Firstly, the game did not release at midnight as it did on consoles; instead, PC players were expected to wait anywhere from a few to over 12 hours to play. This is unacceptable in 2019. Secondly, the game runs poorly and looks noticeably worse than any other version except the Switch. Again, unacceptable in 2019. The art style of the game is bright and cartoon-like, a departure from MK X's realistic tone (This is more of a personal gripe but still something I do not like.)

The entire game is stuffed to the brim with every trope you can think of. Microtransactions? Everywhere. Grind?  Literally everywhere. Denuvo? Oh yeah it's got that too.

The developers have said they intend to fix the balancing issues and currency (kurrency?) problems. I don't care. They are only fixing it because of the backlash, much like they kept it underwraps as long as possible because they KNEW there would be a backlash. 

I would recommend to wait until a GOTY or heavily discounted version is available. It is not worth $60 USD, let alone $100  USD for the Premium Edition. I'm reinstalling MK X. I'm more than happy to play that until MK 11 becomes worth the money - if it ever does at all.

review: until they fix the constant sever crashes, lack of patch support, and broken fps caps I refuse to recommend this game. In an  era where seemingly flawed and untested games is becoming a norm this is hardly a breakthrough. Sure, MK11 is polished in the sense of finished content but NRS seems to be falling into the micro transaction/ broken at release trap that many "Triple A Titles" are plagued with. I havent even started on the fact that certain fighters aren't even playable in online. With uneven frame distribution and constant nerfs to fighters that arent scorpion and subzero, NRS is making this game seem less and less appealing

game_description: Mortal Kombat is back and better than ever in the next evolution of the iconic franchise.
review:
The good
Built-in benchmark (standard for modern fighting games)
Stable 60 fps during fights (i7-6700K @ 4GHz, GeForce GTX 980, 16 GB RAM)
Quick matchmaking
My online matches have been free of noticeable lag so far
Great tutorials, including character-specific tutorials
Decent set of graphics options
Supports ultrawide resolutions in fights
Offline play for the story mode, Klassic Towers, local fights, and practice
The bad
Locked to 60 fps in fights (typical for fighting games), and dips to 30 fps for certain scenes (Fatal Blows, Brutalities, Fatalities), in menus, and in the non-combat Krypt mode
Ultrawide not supported by menus or Krypt mode
Must be online to play the Towers of Time mode
Must be online to store and retrieve character customizations (they're temporary while offline)
The over-complicated multi-currency system and store are a bit much
It's been stable for me, but some users report crashing


but like every figter game people keep doing cheap an noob ticks  onver an over again



honestly  wait for a sale!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

review:
The most non-politically correct hyper-violent video game of its day has somehow begun virtue signaling about morals and ethics through smug interviews, terrible character models, grid walls, pc storylines that trash its own mythos, and on and on.  How did Mortal Kombat end up smug and woke?  It makes no sense, and it caught me off guard when I purchased this mediocre turd.  Half-naked roid-raged men are allowed (and encouraged!), but not beautiful women?  Nope.  They have to look like butch half-breed men, apparently, or go fully clothed, hiding their faces, because women looking attractive is sexist, I guess.  And cheap bottom of the barrel political slants in the cut scenes and story lines.

But, if that isn't enough, even the most bleeding heart will be aghast at the giant grinding paywalls that nickel and dime you for the basic features on which you just spent the usual (though astonishing) 80 bucks, thinking you had already purchased them.  Tower after tower, chest after chest...endless time or money so you can get what should have been included in the price of the game.

This game ****.  It is like work.  Like going to play those crummy ticket games at the crummy modern arcade where you spend $100 to hit the button at the right time just get enough tickets to win a 5 dollar stuffed animal.

I will go back and play the old MK games or find something else to do.  This is game truly made me depressed about the entire video game industry.  The fun is gone.  Might as well buy a freemium mobile game.  This game was clearly made to spite its fans.  And it worked.

game_description: Mortal Kombat is back and better than ever in the next evolution of the iconic franchise.
review: This game is not ready for prime-time. I've played it for about 10 hours, and there are still a number of bugs affecting customizability (crashed 10x in less than an hour) and king of the hill mode (game consistently locks up, forced to kill through task manager). The tower games are impossible due to the level modifiers + damage. The Krypt mode and all the addons and modifiers are more thought out than in MKX, but it also makes the game feel incredibly grindy. I would recommend waiting until the first few rounds of stability patches come out before purchasing.

review:
Im really disappointed. I waited soooo long to play this game. But it's just horrible.

The graphics looks horrible (not even nearly as good as the in game trailers show)
Microtransactions ruining the game completely
30 fps lock in fatal blow/fatality or krypt
In 50 Min playtime 9 crashes (even if I only navigated in menus)

Dont buy this game. Dont support unfinished games like that. But first of all I'm gonna refund.

review: A fluid fighting game, but absolutely crushed with predatory practices. The way the game is made is to force the microtransactions down our throats. Pretty much half the game is locked behind a hellish grind. You need thousands of upon thousands of hours to maybe, just maybe unlock everything. You're literally playing and paying to buy a chance of maybe gettings something what you want. Imagine a game made by EA, but 10 times worse when it comes to ingame economy. Microtransactions and lootboxes in 60 - 120€ game like MK11 need to go out. There is no place for them.

game_description: Mortal Kombat is back and better than ever in the next evolution of the iconic franchise.
review: Spent 100 dollars on this game and preordered it just to find out there are only 25 characters and you still have to buy frost ... after spending 100 dollars and supporting the title months before release. I was playing the game the hour it came out and was disappointed within a few hours. Not only is that frost DLC a ripoff attempt to squeeze more money out of long time fans, but there are hardly enough characters there already to justify locking frost behind a transaction. After armageddon (64 characters!!!) we began to diversify the characters we played and fell in love with ones that haven't been back since. This game was made in unreal and has the full capability of jacking it up with content and I'm disappointed that we don't see larger rosters from you guys like you forgot about some of the characters. This story arc was fully capable of incorporating all characters from the old timeline and we barely saw any besides clones of already existing new timeline characters. And it really♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥me off that Kung Jin and Takeda are gone. That being said the custimization is off the chain and the new mechanics are incredible. This game has evolved far beyond what I ever would have thought. If the character situation wasn't so lazy and we weren't being gouged for extra money, this review would have been way better.

game_description: Mortal Kombat is back and better than ever in the next evolution of the iconic franchise. The new graphics engine showcasing every skull-shattering, eye-popping moment, brings you so close to the fight you can feel it. And featuring a roster of new and returning Klassic Fighters, Mortal Kombat's best in class cinematic story mode continues the epic saga over 25 years in the making.
review:
This game is the perfect presentation of the corporate machine in videogames: horrible and long grindings, paywalls, random rewards for your effort (also known as lootboxes, but they don't "use that word" here), terrible PC port with no support whatsoever and patches that make no difference.

This game must be killed. This abomination is everything wrong with the videogame market nowadays.

game_description: Mortal Kombat is back and better than ever in the next evolution of the iconic franchise. review:
Take away the **** you lose the bitties. This is a prime example of misunderstanding your audience.
Gorgeous combat and fluid mechanics are offset by excessive use of micro transactions to progress. The sex appeal of many characters has been a great incentive for quite a few gamers to purchase a copy, and the exclusion of several fan favourites like Mileena and Reptile furthers to decrease excitement for this game.

I have no grudge against Jax's ending or them force fitting politics into the game. But reducing the sex appeal of the main female leads is a move that will have lasting consequences for the foreseeable future.

review: They couldn't have done worse with this game. I was really interested when it was first announced since it seemed to be the best game of the franchise, but I can't stand all the politics around this game. Microtransactions, monetization everywhere, online required for offline things... It's awful and I can't forgive these things, specially in an incomplete game of 60 $.

review:
Save your money and purchase this game months if not a year down the road. The game lacks the support from the developers and continues to focus it's efforts on PS4. NRS and WB are more than likely going to pull some MKXL down the road while us "Beta" testers work out the issues for MK 11 on PC. 

Please save your money.. The Elder Gods Demand It.

review:
OK, so I was really waiting for this game to come out, bought Premium Edition and.... I have to say I feel cheated. There are some good sides as nice and as big character roster as in previous games, no x-rays, but there is not many more good things.
- Gameplay feels less fluid than in X
- Microtransacions and pay walls everywhere, you will need to spend some serious time if you want to unlock most of the stuff they have hidden
- Graphics, cut-scenes aren't that good as they should be
- Character design is... v bad. And I'm not talking about that "less sexualized" thing. It's just how most of characters act or look is kinda... boring, uninteresting.
- Pity they didn't implement gear mechanics from Injustice 2... and all the cosmetic changes are mostly only colour change. Whoever was designing costumes did a veeery bad job.﻿

In the beginning I was giving it a 4, but now I think 3 is better. The games is extremely mediocre. I had way higher expectations.

review: First off this is the most disappointing mortal kombat I have ever played.  Not only has NRS MOCKED THEIR FANBASE, but they have took MK and turned it into a complete mess of political agenda.  Not only that their design choices are the worst. Females look like men and nothing like how they used to. They even go to the extent and give other characters that are not in the game their special signature moves probably because of lack of design and creativity.  NRS and WB have hit a new low with this game by attacking the consumer and not their staff.  I wouldn’t be surprised if they get a lot of returns because the gameplay is not what it once was.  They really hit an all time new low.  Don’t ask them for classic characters either they will mock you all over Twitter Facebook and Instagram.  They seriously need to get their act together.

They really hit an all time new low.  Don’t ask them for classic characters either they will mock you all over Twitter Facebook and Instagram.  They seriously need to get their act together.
review_bomb_reason: Das Spiel erhielt zu Release sehr viele negative Bewertungen, unter anderem aufgrund der von den Entwicklern "Netherrealm Studios" angeblich eingebauten "Social Justice Warrior / SJW - Propaganda" und politischen Agenda (weil in einem der Enden des Spiels ein dunkelhäutiger Charakter in die Vergangenheit reist, um die Sklaverei abzuschaffen), vielen Mikrotransaktionen und dem Fehlen von beliebten Charakteren aus früheren Teilen der Serie.

game_description: Mortal Kombat is back and better than ever in the next evolution of the iconic franchise.
review:
NOT OPTIMIZED YET ( GTX 1050TI)

Update - The game runs in the 50s. 50 to 54 Fps which is playable but is sluggish at times.. i have seen some people running at a solid 60 fps using this graphics card.. it seems to be happening to some users. i have played the campaign of the game it was quite short and was fun so i cant complain but im running into a lot of performance issues. Online is completely unplayable due to Frame skipper. 

Needs support for a wider range of graphics cards.
Need to fix frame skipper.
Fix performance issues.

game_description: Mortal Kombat is back and better than ever in the next evolution of the iconic franchise. The all new Custom Character Variations give you unprecedented control to customize the fighters and make them your own. The new graphics engine showcasing every skull-shattering, eye-popping moment, brings you so close to the fight you can feel it. And featuring a roster of new and returning Klassic Fighters, Mortal Kombat's best in class cinematic story mode continues the epic saga over 25 years in the making.
review:
Mortal Kombat 11 is very disappointing, been a fan since I was 10 years old (24 now) I have purchased and played almost every MK game from MK2 to MK11, despite Mortal Kombat 11 lacking a lot of fan favorite characters like Mileena & Reptile and the females being overdressed for political correctness I still bought the game because I was a huge fan but I regret it. The new single player modes: Tower of time is unfair and impossible to beat because of cheap Test your Luck modifiers on top of hard AI bosses with huge amount of health. The Krypt used to be a fun minigame to unlock skins and fatalities but in MK11 it's filled with lootboxes that gives random items which are mostly one time consumables that can be used in Towers of time, also they added microtransactions that are similar to mobile games or free to play games after making costumers pay $60-$100, it's very insulting.
If the economy and grind is not significantly reduced soon this game will die quickly.

review:
A game should never nickel and dime you when you've paid as much as this game costs. This absolutely must be fixed.

Update: While NetherRealm has mitigated some of the customer exploitation, the game still has a lot of exploitative elements. Want Kitana without a mask for example? Prepare to spend millions of credits, as the source for it costs 75K each try, is random, and provides dupes among a large pool of items.

review:
Grindy trash... thanks WB.
I don't like to give a 0, but the singleplayer is the only part I'm interested in, but it's completely destroyed in this game, which makes the whole game completely useless to me.

Of course, the devs wanna fix it, but it seems to be part of a plan.
They have bad grinding in mind, but put in terrible grinding.
So they just change the extremely terrible grinding to the bad grinding, they already had in mind.
Which won't turn the game into a good game.

So yeah... f*ck you WB.

review:
Fighting game with MMO economy,
Rewarding Brain dead grind which keeps the player for grinding to actually get better at the game,
The Story was good for a Fighting game and the graphics , fatalities , combat is spot on.
But other than that the game is a **** Devs do not give a damn about PC version since we are like 2 or 3 patches behind , unable to make progress since towers are broken and the economy is extremely sluggish. Do not buy the game , boycott it , or wait until its 10$  on a secondary market site.
The game is not a 0/10 , but my review , and i believe most peoples review is just to send a message , so they do not try to pull something like this again.

review:
The game has several problems. First of all, lots of political agenda in story mode and character designs. All women are wearing body armor to not show breasts, butt or legs, with hair stuck in ponytails. All are horrible, they only have two types of garment Power Rangers armors like Frost or  burkas like Jade. They even have a cutscene in the ACTUAL game talking about sexism. I don't understand the logic, plucking the inner organs of someone is cool, but cleavage is evil?

This game has one of the worst monetization schemes I've ever seen in my life, toe to toe with Eletronic Arts. The towers are grindy as hell, to force you to buy the items they sell and the towers are the only way of unlocking skins, fatalities, brutalities rather than buying for five **** dollars each. And most skins are awful, with just colored versions of the standard. Exactly what you read, a Red Kitana costs five dollars. And this game has lootboxes disguised in the Krypt. In a game that costs $60? Really, Netherrealm?

The gameplay and graphics are excellent and brutal. The animations are great. The new mechanics are interesting. The story mode is ok, nothing spectacular, but it's better than the embarassment we saw in MK X. Popular characters are missing like Mileena, Kenshi, Sindel, Reptile, Rain, etc. When Cassie Cage and Jackie are still in the games, why?

It's a good game, easily a 7/10. But I'm giving 0 in protest of monetization schemes and the SJW content, that's not what I want for the franchise I love since childhood.

game_description: Mortal Kombat is back and better than ever in the next evolution of the iconic franchise.
review:
Game mechanics itself. Great. BUT THIS ABSURD TOWERS IS JUST A JOKE. It's an INSULT for HARD games. Hard = Spam 1 range combo because whole tower of enemies stun you every 2 sec when you move close to them. This is not Hard, this is just tiresome most boring way to gain ALMOST no prize at all. 20,000 Gold which you spend on 3 concept arts and 20 stupid power ups which is not needed at all. You want a normal Tower? Ok, sure. There you go. but you gonna make around 10,000 for an hour and that's not much at all. The grinding is INSANE. Want some cool gear for your best character. NOPE It's fully RNG. This is first time in my life I'm so angry at 1 game. I can accept enemies who have 3x more hp than you, flying rockets which you can just dodge or a boss who makes your screen fully black for 5 sec everytime he hits you. BUT STUNS EVERY 2 FUCKING SECONDS when I can just watch how enemy take me 40% of my health with 1 big combo because i'm getting stuned in the air and after beating him i get another bs character with then FREEZ you instead of SHOCK and then another character who just BURN you to the ground. That's just ridiciolous at this point when i just throw at them shit for 1 hour and I'm getting insane. I'm Souls player, I know what fair-hard is. I know how it is like to fight 1 boss for 10 H and not getting angry because it's your foult. 
But this is just big NO

review:
Krypta and Towers were programmed to make the player lose, forcing the micro-transaction. The game currency is worthless, as the chests are mega inflated. Using the game currency, he could only get useless rewards. Krypta is a trap that hides a vast loot box system.

Another downside is the requirement to always stay online in a single player mode.

Female persogens have more cloth than skin, can barely breathe. It does not have the classic skins.

There are no classic characters like Mileena, Rain, Smoke, Reptile. For example, Mileena was one of the most beloved characters and played on MKX. What they do? They pull her out at 11.

You have to learn to respect your consumer, if you have already paid for the game, you have no reason to pay into it again with microtransactions. It has to deliver the consumer expects and is part of the franchise, without bowing to political agendas.

game_description: Mortal Kombat is back and better than ever in the next evolution of the iconic franchise.
review:
I'm sorry but I carn't bring myself to give this a positive review. I'm gonna start with the negative and my experiences,
LETS START WITH TOWER OF TIME my first attempt was going quite well till i got to the boss which in this case was noob saibot he had a boost where every 4 seconds the screen goes black and all i can hear is my character getting his ass kicked. the screen stays black for about 10 seconds then repeats again i tried to defeat him 6 fucking times and could not do it and ending up in me rage quitting.  my second tower i got to the boss which in this case was shal kon  he had two effects one was blood drain and i can not remember the other. as soon as he activities blood drain I'm dead within 4 seconds my health starts to rapidly go down and that's  with out him hitting me, If he hits me then I'm dead within 2  or 3 hits. sounds so FUN doesn't it  NetherRealm.  the game is also repetitive and a grind fest when it comes to rewards. 
as for the game it as a great story and when not playing TOWER OF TIME the game play is fun. the reason i give this a negative is because you don't pay £50 for a game and have TO GRIND TO UNLOCK THINGS the grind in this game seriously takes the piss.

game_description: Mortal Kombat is back and better than ever in the next evolution of the iconic franchise.
review:
Occasional crashing on a 1070 rig that can run most games at more than 90fps at max settings 
Menu navigation capped at a sluggish 30fps
Eternal grind for unlocks (probably to be fixed)
In-fight cinematics (intros, outros, krushing/fatal blows) drop the framerate to 30fps (can't tell if that's a cap or the port)
Load times are suffering 
Many more disappointments in and outside of the game

Consider buying if you have a friend to vs. against and value that fun over the sluggishness surrounding it.
There's a good game in here somewhere.

review: Man it REALLY goes to show how disconnected developers and games journalism is from the general audience when at the time of this review there are nearly 500 negative reviews for this game from the general audience and 0 from journalists. Either way the garbage grind that the once loved crypt has turned into, tons of micro-transactions, not disclosing that Frost is unlockable in game and charging for her, the insanely divisive political **** shoe-horned into the game, and omitting tons of fan favorite characters really bring down the experience of this game overall. If anything good can be said about this game it's that the gameplay is pretty, but you can get that and everything this game is missing (besides good online play if you're buying the PC release) from MKXL and that's 20-30 bucks. Do yourself a favor and just avoid this dumpster fire that's sure to only grow in the same way that games like Black ops 4 did.

review:
The SJW garbage is bad enough, but on a purely structural level, I take serious offense with any developer that designs a game from the ground up with micro-transactions throughout. It's just too flagrantly greedy and offering a ridiculously grindy second option is equally insulting. Nobody, and I mean NOBODY wants to play a game knowing there are boat-loads of content that they aren't getting with the full-price game that they either have to pay out the *** to get or grind for thousands of hours. It doesn't matter how good the gameplay is when this tactic of content-carrot-dangling blankets over the game and ruins the whole feel.

...and it still bears mentioning- inserting politics- especially this way that goes against what MK has always been about not only goes against about 50% of the country's leaning, but completely alienates the core formula of MK and the core fanbase. That garbage reeks of arrogance and I guarantee cost the developer sales. Thing is- they had to know this, and the did it anyway. This is self-righteousness and virtue signaling on a whole new level.

MK has been ruined and I will not bother looking in its general direction again unless it ends up in the hands of someone else.

What a shame.

game_description: Mortal Kombat is back and better than ever in the next evolution of the iconic franchise.
review:
I normally don't post reviews super early for games, but I'm gonna have to jump on the review bomb ship on account of the terrible grind found in the game's unlockable content. Anyway, aside from that here are some early impressions...

Pros: It plays pretty good, character designs are cool, graphics are solid, story was fun

Cons: awful grind, piss poor rewards for playing the game, cosmetic options are locked behind the previously mentioned grind, loading screens make my beefy gaming rig sound like a jet engine, cutscenes run at 30 fps and there are weird graphical issues that make scorpions beard look like a holographic pokemon card

The Variation system suuuuuuucks. It is so confusing and I really don't give a shit about learning how it works. I just want to use the tournament legal/ranked moves. I don't even want to bother customizing a character with different moves if they're banned in competitive play. 

Don't buy it until they sort it out and  hopefully add further pc optimization. This is only an okay port in my experience. I'm running an i7 8700, gtx 1080, and 16 GB of RAM but my computer hates something about the loading screens in this game.

review: The game would of been at least 4 or 5 stars if they didn't pull micro-transactions garbage. Literally we get games that do the same sh!t over and over again. Yet, they don't learn from each other. I don't mind if you have to pay for skins but to make it pay to win in the Towers of Time really made me give this game a 1-2 stars. I've been a fan since the start and you really lost me after I was done the story mode. Like really acid rain that constantly drains my health or these blood missiles that you cannot block and gives the health to the enemy. What is this shit? I really want to love this game but I cannot with this pay to win scheme. I recommend not to buy this game unless they fix this. It's the only way companies stop pulling this selfish garbage. As if paying almost $100 for a game is not enough to get a decent play through.

review: HUGE Mk fan. Have every single game even the questionable experimental ones. Absolutely gutted by this. Its a JOKE. It looks amazing and plays amazing and then they completely honestly ruin it with propaganda, forced grinding gameplay, insane difficulty. I wish they would admit what its all about. They want microtransactions for everything or a million hours playing against unbeatable AI. They removed womens boob type clothing (i dont care seriously) but they said its because u wouldnt show that skin in a fight but yet the men do.? Admit your propaganda and pandering Ed Boon, Netherealm, Warner Bros. I feel like some Social Justice warriors made the decisions here. Im so sickened that they got a full days pay off me. I dont have this type of money to waste and waste it I did. I feel like I have a free to play game that costs a fortune to win. Terrible terrible decision. Im out Ed.

The new graphics engine showcasing every skull-shattering, eye-popping moment, brings you so close to the fight you can feel it. And featuring a roster of new and returning Klassic Fighters, Mortal Kombat's best in class cinematic story mode continues the epic saga over 25 years in the making.
review: It costs $6440 to unlock this games skins, fatalities, and brutalities. Nearly everything is locked behind a pay wall + an impossible grind without spending money. I'm so sad, I was looking forward to this game. The campaign may be fun, but NetherRealm's disgusting greed earns a 2/10 from me. This is F2P nonsense that isn't justifiable in a full priced game and I feel ripped off for preordering it. This is shameful.
review_bomb_reason: Das Spiel erhielt zu Release sehr viele negative Bewertungen, unter anderem aufgrund der von den Entwicklern "Netherrealm Studios" angeblich eingebauten "Social Justice Warrior / SJW - Propaganda" und politischen Agenda (weil in einem der Enden des Spiels ein dunkelhäutiger Charakter in die Vergangenheit reist, um die Sklaverei abzuschaffen), vielen Mikrotransaktionen und dem Fehlen von beliebten Charakteren aus früheren Teilen der Serie.

game_description: Mortal Kombat is back and better than ever in the next evolution of the iconic franchise. The all new Custom Character Variations give you unprecedented control to customize the fighters and make them your own. The new graphics engine showcasing every skull-shattering, eye-popping moment, brings you so close to the fight you can feel it. And featuring a roster of new and returning Klassic Fighters, Mortal Kombat's best in class cinematic story mode continues the epic saga over 25 years in the making.
review: I can accept micro transactions that are reasonable (even though I disagree with this business model) however the micro transactions in this game are far from reasonable. $5 for a character skin and to purchase everything comes to over $6000, how ridiculous. I would rather buy a car and drive it into a tree than to pay this amount of money on one video game. I understand that you do not have to spend money to obtain these items as they are obtainable through game play however the  time investment needed is too unrealistic. It is surprising how stupid some business's decisions can be, thinking people would not realise this and not become unhappy from it. I would highly recommend for people to not purchase this game unless some serious changes are made. The game has other problems but this one is my main gripe. I had previously trusted Ed Boon and NetherRealm, this trust has now been lost. Companies need to understand that it is much more difficult to gain trust than it is to lose it. I will not be purchasing any DLC or future games from this company until changes are made.

review:
I'm done. I'm devastated. I waited for almost a week for things to get better. For all this time I was grinding and grinding and grinding. I never got a skin I was hunting for. And finally I got a key to the tower where was a nice, good-looking skin. And what? Blocked by modifiers. I was almost crying when I was dying and dying and dying without being hit by an AI opponent. And that is 6 freaking days after a game being released. No patches. No community service. Nothing.

And all this politics and SJW in the game. Favorite female characters destroyed. I said to myself - Ok. At least they havent ruined male characters. I can play with them. I closed my eyes to everything, that they ruined. But showing no support to players that are struggling with all this nonsense in creepy mode called - Towers of Time. That just ****. This game is not gamers friendly. The company is not gamers friendly. They are all about politics and taking your money with microtransactions.

P.S. And in social media they are treating people like horse s**t. This is worse then EA.
