game_description: Mortal Kombat is back and better than ever in the next evolution of the iconic franchise.
review:
This game is one of the worst ports to date.

The game crashes NON STOP on Fullscreen, forcing you to play Borderless, which gives you at best 40fps, with massive stutters when stage events happen (for exemple the blood wave splashing against the rocks in the Sea of Blood stage)

I thought the era of shit fighting game ports was over, with Tekken 7 and DBFZ being major hits and having near perfect ports, but apparently not.

Do not buy this on PC, I have 5hours, 3 of these were me playing Borderless out of love for the franchise, the 2 others were me trying to find out what the fuck is wrong with the game before giving up.

What a mess.

review:
Devs have successfully cheated us and critics on thinking this game was a gem, turns out it's a intolerable grind money grabbing mobile-like structure with frustrating towers, 5 different in-game currencies not including your own money to farm excruciatingly slowly just to gain any customization for your characters of choice or core MK flairs like Brutalities.

We cannot let game developers and their clients outright CHEAT us out of this time and money...
They knew what they were doing, it's disgustingly corrupt.

review:
The game kinda ruins a lot of what can be loved about MK. The fighting is decent, but everything else, from the out of place tower endings to an insane grind to always online hurts the experience. Why would anyone play MK11 when there are plenty of upcoming and released fighters (T7, UNIST, SamSho, even DBFZ) that are just better in every way? It's hard to justify the pricepoint at this time.

Garbage from WB

review: AI action model and Living Towers modificators are complete nonsense which don't let a casual player into the game on it's full. As of now not recommended unless your spinal cord allows you to see the world in near-stopped time and react as fast. The "difficulty curve adjustment" update did not do sh__ to lower it, actually it did exactly the opposite. The first initial battles are indeed easier but then it just spikes to the "you don't get to do sh__, boi" level. The only valid way to play the towers is to make an AI fighter with 30/30 on rushdown and combos and let them play this bullsh__ game by themselves.

review:
While the game is fun to play to a point and if your looking for a Fighter I would just play X. 
During combat, attacks would not register like Upper Cuts and combos. Combat looked and felt clunky at time not feeling smooth at all. distance for basic attacks like punches and kick that should normally land miss. It seem the only time NPC's were better is when they seem to be fighting smoother then I was

In the time I have played so far It has crash 2 different time while playing. The story was ok at best with me wondering where other Characters from 10 were at for 11 that play a big part of the story. They even mention the fights during the story mode as if they were just wipe off the face of the game. Also the fact that some characters will be in one cut seen fighting in a large group battle while in the next seen fighting for the other side as a oversight. On top of that for some reason playing the story I got a  headaches Some thing about the cut seen's were off as if they were not flowing right almost like little stuttering you see it worst when the end credits were rolling by. For some reason also sometime I think the graphics are not fully Rendering in the Crypt area or im hoping its not fully become texture where bad.

game_description: Mortal Kombat is back and better than ever in the next evolution of the iconic franchise.
review: I'll start by saying im not a fan of X-Ray moves. They slow the game down, and drain half of your health, while requiring little to no real skill to pull off. Plus when you activate one, you drop to 30fps. 30fps in cutscenes. 3 mobile game quality currencies. Ridiculous AI. I mean ridiculous, the AI will literally zone you, or pull off perfect counters or combo breakers. Characters facial hair materializes, and dematerializes, like its some kind of ghost beard. The game just looks blurry, and thats not just the 30fps forced scenes. Lots of characters are missing, cant wait for them to come out as paid DLC...especially since youd already have to pay over $6,500 to own everything, if you choose to bypass the insanely difficult towers and grind in the RNG Krypt anyway.

game_description: Mortal Kombat is back and better than ever in the next evolution of the iconic franchise.
review:
So. First things first. The gameplay of MK 11 feels like a twosteps forward one step back from MK 10. combo's feel easier overall, though most require that you enhance a special move to not end the string after a single hit string to special, which is... alright i guess.

My big gripe, as is many reviewers, is the micro transactions. for a full price game on release to attempt to extract more money through a randomized lootbox system and in game consumables is extremely disheartening. The fact that on release the main way to get customization pieces (the Towers of Time) are not dictated entirely by player skill, but by having the correct immunity consumable causes those of us with less than legendary abillity at the game to want to drop the game entirely.

Ending statement: The game is good, but the monetization practice of Nether Realm Studios/ Warner Bros. should be criticized much in the same way that EA's Starwars Battlefield was. It is unnacceptable and appalling.

4/30 Update: NRS, if you bother looking at reviews, I hope that more reviewers than I let you know that 3 hearts per fatality is still not a good reward if you need 250 hearts per chest, you need to do 87 fatals per chest. Kind of absurd don't you think? in addition, the towers of time gimmicks still suck. You've put two patches through and it is still absolute agony to attempt to make it through a single tower island in my daily play time. Reduce tower enemies to player hp, or get rid of their gimmicks that force the player to relinquish control of the match, High HP pools and forced breaks in offensive pressure make the game tedious in the extreme.

game_description: Mortal Kombat is back and better than ever in the next evolution of the iconic franchise.
review:
MK11 is okay, but I do not recommend it in its current form. The normal gameplay and graphics are really good. Story is well done.  Online multiplayer has run well so far.  
    Positives aside, the game has some negatives. Some minor ones? The voice acting of Rhonda Rousey is indeed bad, when compared to the other voice actors in game. Gameplay is too similar to MKX, making it not feel new at all. All these issues can be dealt with, but what can't be is the Towers of TIme, a major game mode that is played to unlock items and for those who enjoy solo play or practice against CPU. That and microtransactions, which are looking to be excessive.
   The Towers of TIme are simply a grind, with many advantages given to the CPU opponent that are many times unbeatable unless the player cheeses a victory. It makes achieving victory through normal gameplay nigh impossible, forcing players to cheese out wins or use the AI to control the player. Basically undoes the point of playing a game.  The developer has received many complaints about this, and have said it will be fixed, but until then, don't buy it if you have any interest in solo gameplay.

review:
I am a big Mortal Kombat fan and as a fan i trusted the folks at NetherRealm Studios (BIG MISTAKE)
some of the mistakes i made are as follows .
.
1) Bought The Premium Edition :- only 7 extra **** skins wear given to premium edition owners , just the basic costume with colour change , NO coins , NO extra stupid currencies , NO backgrounds , NOTHING PREMIUM whatsoever (Robbed us)

2) Played The BETA :- Beta fooled us all , showed us the content is unlocked and in final game even less **** was given (fooled us)

3) Thought there are NO Lootboxes :- Krypt is a **** lootbox itself , every treasure has RNG , and even they can be reopened again and again , so they are the **** lootboxes . (Lied to us)

4) Thought devs respect the fans :- Grindy and rewardless Gameplay (Slap on the face)

5) Devs wont mess with our beloved MK :- ohhh yes they did , ruined the reward and experience with rewardless plays , added 4 diffrent types of currency , time of towers was **** , consumables are pathetic , krypt RNG is crap , and Majority of game content is locked behind paywall .

LONG STORY SHORT ;- They messed upp long time , i feel robbed and fooled . Non of the fans are happy . Because of all the things i mentioned above i wont talk about actual game and story . no matter how good the actual game is , but these pathetic practices have cost them a lot , fans are angry , its gonna be a rough path ahead for NetherRelms if they keep messing with fans

review:
Cannot recommend this game on PC in its current state as it has been revealed the PC (and Switch) versions of this game are several builds behind the console editions, which most importantly affects frame-data and combos so you can be spending hours learning incorrect combos.

If you are currently debating which platform to get this game on, as it stands PS4 and Xbox are your best choices.

Hopefully this issue gets cleared up soon...

review:
WB and NRS need to be reminded that consoles are not smartphones! Do they take us for fools, saying there would be no lootboxes and giving us that Krypt?

I'm a huge fan of cosmetics and do understand that they may need to be paid for, especially when they are constantly created and provided throughout the lifespan ****. But, that is so not what is happening on MK11. I had already paid for the game, was I supposed to pay a lot more to enjoy all its content? Hell no! Returned my copy and asked for a refund.

game_description: Mortal Kombat is back and better than ever in the next evolution of the iconic franchise.
review:
Spent 15 hours in the game going through towers, story, and some personal training to try and 'git gud' before jumping into ranked only to find out you can't use custom variations in ranked.  Why the fuck not?  The game is balanced around all these moves anyways.  So now my options are that I either can't play the characters the way I want or I just don't play ranked at all.

Both options are ridiculous and ruins one of the main reasons I was going to even play the damn game.  Also, take this bullshit time-based bottom of the barrel cell phone game mechanics out.  It's like you guys are deliberately trying to piss players off.

* No fanservice characters like Mileena, Rain, Smoke and more, being that these are the most requested and popular.
* No Secret  Characters like you NRS promissed, just Frost.
* Disc Locked Content like Shao Kahn.
* Always online connection to unlock content.
* Krypt giant lootbox.
* I hate You Ed Boon and NRS, give back my money.

review:
Pros:
-The Graphics

Cons:
-You have to have internet access to play a good 75% of the game, you can't even unlock items without the internet.
-Towers of Time are ridiculous
-Items in the Krypt are entirely random. Meaning you may need to open 600 chests, beat the story mode, beat a bunch of Towers of Time before you find the one item you are looking for.
-Microtransactions.

review:
This version has really lost its charm, with a progression system commonly seen in mobile games.  The worst kind of monetization to date - loot boxes and decision tree style unlockables.

Just noticed it has got woke on top of that.  The two biggest factors on how to kill a game - excessive greed and going woke.  MK11 has done both.

Such a shame as I have purchased every game in the series to date, but now I have lost all trust in the franchise.

review: Like many others that I see on these reviews I also created this account just to leave this feedback.  I was hype for MK11 and work in a position where I am constantly talking to customers about what games they may like, needless to say I had shared my excitement with them about MK11.  While there are good aspects about this game such as the pure 1v1 fighting and the story mode, I feel that after completing the story moving to the Towers of Time will ruin your experience.  I am not a pro player by far but at least let me loose to an opponent and not a laser from off screen, or a fireball, or another fighter running through etc etc.  Does anyone actually think this is FUN ?  and what pops up on the screen when you lose these fights ? SKIP FIGHT WITH A TOKEN... WTF ?  Congrats you made a game that acknowledges that I won't want to play the actual game parts.   I will suggest that if you want to play mortal kombat rent this game for the story mode then buy MKX or go back and play MK9 for the tower mode.  Very very disappointed.

review:
Developers made an awful decision by spitting on their main customer base, guys. Except the fact that the main boss is female, the story is this: females are heroic, clever, strong, fighting for the good cause while men are either evil or dumb or white knight or with a lack of personality.
Gaming (same as sports) are supposed to be one of the last safe spaces for men in this feminism driven world. MK11 failed to make us feel like heroes.

game_description: Mortal Kombat is back and better than ever in the next evolution of the iconic franchise.
review:
Once again, NRS has failed to make a game that is even remotely playable on a below-average setup. I've played pretty much every PC fighting game, and only Injustice 2 and MK11 fail to work on even the lowest graphic settings. They should seriously consider outsourcing their ports to a more competent developer in that regard.

I wanna love it, but I can't run it until I start messing with config files. Negative review left purely for visibility of the problem.

game_description: Mortal Kombat is back and better than ever in the next evolution of the iconic franchise.
review:
Remove the "quit" option from online 1v1 matches and then I'll change my recommend. Right before I win they quit. Every, single, game. You don't get a win for it and they don't get a loss (in ranked match, they get a loss in kasual still). Win/Loss is distorted, you never get to do FATALITIES which means you never get hearts, or any other rewards for finishing a match, and basically ruins the Mortal Kombat experience.

I thought QUITALITY was making a return but it never does it. It says "game has desynced". I ONLY get this message right before I win the second match even with both players at good connection so it's obvious a quitter.  I don't see why quitting is even allowed, matches last 5 minutes and kompetitive is at most 15. Any other competitive modes in online games usually gives penalties.

Game is great besides this and would recommend it. But I mainly play online because I like playing humans so quitting with no consequences completely ruins the experience for me.

I don't have a problem with the micro-transactions that don't alter gameplay. All real money does is speed the cosmetics process up, why do people care if other people want to spend money to speed the process up?? I am however super pissed Frost was sold for 6$ when you get her for free in the story mode......... I bought the premium edition of the game and straight up thought they forgot to add Frost. Yeah, I got reamed real good for that.

review: What everyone is saying is true. The gameplay itself as a fighting game is GREAT, BUT (and this is huge) the rest of the single player content is BROKEN. All the character customization and cool shit is locked behind RNG loot boxes! If that is not enough they even make it next to impossible to get anything you want or get currency to TRY and rng for the things you want. The rewards for getting anything is terrible. The amount of grind and stupid things to lock you out of things is BROKEN! This has to be the most greedy and scummy microtransaction filled game I have seen since SW Battlefield 2. DO NOT BUY UNTIL THEY FIX THIS!

game_description: Mortal Kombat is back and better than ever in the next evolution of the iconic franchise.
review: Not only does the game have an absolutely broken Krypt and Tower of Time system (that they said they WOULD fix) the port itself is also very dodgy. Even on max setting this game looks pretty poor, almost like they accidentally ported the switch version by accident. The texture quality is very dodgy and the AA and hair effects look absolutely dreadful. It is VERY distracting to look at, especially when playing story mode when the cut scenes transition to the gameplay, it's absolute night and day. Even the performance is on and off for me as well. For the most part, it does run relatively smooth, but the Krypt and Fatal Blows are locked at 30 fps? WTF?!?! Also, I have some stuttering issues as well, but that doesn't happen as often. Absolutely terrible. NRS, fix the gameplay issues and whoever the hell ported this, fix this travesty as well. Cannot recommend at the moment.

game_description: Mortal Kombat is back and better than ever in the next evolution of the iconic franchise.
review:
Normally don't write reviews, but jeez this game is in a horrid state. Lack of support from developers and as of this writing, the day 1 patch hasn't even been implemented yet. Story is fine and so are the graphics, but that's pretty much where the pros end. 

The Towers are unreasonably difficult. I don't expect rewards to be handed out like candy, but it's ridiculous when you have modifiers that are constantly spamming you every few seconds. The rewards from the various game modes are lackluster to say this least. The developers announced a patch to remedy this, but it might not get to PC the same time as consoles with the way the support has been going. Abysmal support and lack of response from the development team. Dumpster fire and hot garbage sum up the way the game is on PC in its current state.

game_description: Mortal Kombat is back and better than ever in the next evolution of the iconic franchise.
review:
Imagine a mobile game. Now imagine that every single thing you're able to do and unlock in that mobile game was purposefully made to be grindy as humanly possible so that people will have that small temptation in the back of their mind to purchase in-game currency to save them from the hell that awaits. Now imagine the mobile game is called Mortal Kombat 11.

Right now, don't get this game at full price. The combat is deep and there is a lot of content, but it's overshadowed by the disgusting in-game microtransaction practices that weren't revealed until release day. 2019 baby

EDIT: After playing around 50 hours during this edit, I can safely say to all potential buyers DO NOT GET THE PC VERSION. There is no communication with the pc community. It is 4/29/2019 and pc still doesn't have the DAY 1 PATCH. It almost feels like they're intentionally ignoring everything pc related and only give "soon" as an excuse. There was also a 60 FPS mod that was created by a player to fix ultrawide scaling and make krushing blows, fatal blows, fatalities, and the menus 60 FPS to make the game graphically consistent, but it now seems that utilizing the mod is punishable which makes no sense. The game's engine isn't affected by the mod and you aren't given any advantage but a ban is possible. horrible

As for microtransaction practices, I might have spoken too soon for that. It's not expensive in the way you think. It's expensive time-wise. There is so much grinding that it's better to use an ai with a turbo controller if you have one. Even then, you can't have the ai go forever since you'll eventually need to reselect the game modes after your ai dies.

Just don't get the game. If you can get it $40 or less, maybe. Even after that price, don't expect developer cooperation because they won't give you the time.

game_description: Mortal Kombat is back and better than ever in the next evolution of the iconic franchise. The all new Custom Character Variations give you unprecedented control to customize the fighters and make them your own. The new graphics engine showcasing every skull-shattering, eye-popping moment, brings you so close to the fight you can feel it. And featuring a roster of new and returning Klassic Fighters, Mortal Kombat's best in class cinematic story mode continues the epic saga over 25 years in the making.

review:
Its a f*cking mobile game for 60 bucks!

Graphics are totally outdated. MKX looks much better than this thing. Also the color scheme its too dark.
Sound is terrible, Most soundtrack sounds like a superhero thing. MK its not that.
Fatal Blow are beyond ridiculous. You could get your head stabbed three times and still keep fighting.
I could keep going, but im already tired of this thing.

review: A combination of terrible design and storyline choices culminate in a total catastrophe for this franchise.  Online gambling, horrible grinding, and several key fan favourites disconfirmed for inclusion, most importantly Mileena - one of the all-time top four stars of the series. Tried the game out then returned it within a couple of hours for a full refund. Absolutely awful mess.

review:
Mortal Kombat franchise is officially ruined by SJW and Microtransactions.Some tower endings are just the wet dreams of SJWs. SJW female characters and at the same time sexual objectification of male characters. It is a big grind fest and very poorly designed. This game requires grinding to unlock basic, core trademarks of the series like Brutalities. The Krypt is totally random, requiring 3 different forms of currency that, get this, you unlock through grossly laborious tower challenges that aren't fun, and basically completely random "test your luck" type tests of patience and your pocketbook.
Good game NetherRealm Studios, good job Boon.

review:
This is a great game if you are new to fighting games and want to dip your toe in, but as you inevitably get better you might find yourself getting bored fast.

I'm only rating the fighting, just bought the game and am gonna return it, I have no knowledge on any of the other issues. Fighting is probably the slowest I have experienced in awhile, you can telegraph and stun lock opponents pretty quickly because it costs them energy to react quickly using the technique "stand up fast." Fatalities are great (Kassie's heart fatality is the best, fight me) but it feels more like a chore to get to them because the fighting feels bland compared to mk9. I'm probably gonna return the game. Im sure the story mode is great but it says I can't play it for another 4 hours and I don't think I'll enjoy chugging through these fights just to see a story that will be readily available on youtube. It's a shame because I know they worked hard on it, but the gameplay itself isn't rewarding enough for me, sorry. Again if you are new to fighting games, great game to start with because things are slow, but they did take away the ability to chain different kombos so you might have to look at the fighting instructions if you want to land multiple hits.
